info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 30 at 7:09PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT FOR PROWERS AND NORTHEASTERN BENT COUNTIES... At 706 PM MDT, strong to severe thunderstorms were occurring along the highway 50 corridor in eastern Bent and northern Prowers county. the storms were moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...The weather station at Lamar at 7:03 pm was measuring winds to 60 mph. Another strong storm, likely producing hail stones to 1 inch in diameter, was occurring in the Granada area. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lamar, Holly, Granada, Wiley, Hartman, McClave and Bristol. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
